92451.description:
BattleBlock Theater is an upcoming co-operative / competitive platformer video game and the third production from developer The Behemoth following Alien Hominid and Castle Crashers.

A mysterious character who experiences two emotions at the same time, Hatty (some have nicknamed him "Two-Emotion Man"), has kidnapped the player's friends, and it is up to the player to rescue them through a series of trials. Behemoth wrote this in the official BattleBlock Theater Trailer: "Having shipwrecked on a mysterious island you find yourself both betrayed by your best friend Hatty and captured by the locals. All of this is happening while being forced into deadly performances. This however, is just the start of your problems."

Players create a character using shapes and different face styles and give them a weapon to use, and control them using a simple control system of running, jumping, punching and firing a weapon. Punching dazes an opponent, while jumping on their head kills them. Players on the same team can stand on each others heads and help their teammates up ledges. Different weapons have different effects, ranging from explosive devices to effect inducing objects. Levels shown featured different types of blocks, including ones that self-destruct and ones with spikes, as well as hazards such as water and laser cannons. Power-ups include wings that allow players to fly around the level.

Source: Wikipedia, "BattleBlock Theater", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

92452.name: Temple of the Stone
92452.description:
From publisher blurb:

Recently a mining expedition that was hunting for silver has come across an ancient Dwarven temple deep within a mountain. Very little has come back after the initial discovery because the original mining party was lost and a second party was killed to only a few that managed to escape. The few that survived returned bruised and bloodied but could tell nothing of their attackers, claiming to never have seen anything.

92453.name: APG City Tiles
92453.description:
From publisher blurb:

Why spend your time putting together terrain when you have worlds to build? You're a Game Master, not a carpenter!

In this product you will find the basic necessities needed to design a city block: merchant and freeman homes, streets, an inn, a tavern, and an eating hall. Each of these buildings are all put together and ready to go straight to the table once you print them out.

What's Inside:

17 pages of maps tiles. Large building tiles are 8"x10" and the street tiles are 4"x8".
A full color and printer friendly version.
A brief description of medieval buildings and town life to add a little flavor to your city adventures.




Each map tile is 300 dpi - that means you can print it at a lower printer setting and still maintain quality while saving on ink!

92454.name: Power Corrupts Unlimited
92454.description:
From publisher blurb:

From the company that brought you the Power Corrupts series for the best selling Super Hero OGL system on the market today comes their newest release, Power Corrupts Unlimited. Originally created and released as part of the Power Corrupts series, but now revised, updated and released for any general OGL & D20 Superhero system. Power Corrupts Unlimited is the super power sourcebook you need. This sourcebook contains:

Nearly 125 new powers including Addictive Metabolism, Computer Projection, Dimensional Doppleganger, Nano-Machines and Singularity
Nearly 10 all new generic power Extras including Cone, Guiding and Spray
Nearly 20 all New generic power Flaws including Energy Leak, Fuel and Partner
Nearly 10 all new weaknesses including Beast Foe, Outside Power Source and Unusual Metabolism
Over 10 all new strategy tactics including All Guns Blazing, Focused Wedge, Regroup and Scatter.
Nearly 30 all new team Maneuvers including Bait And Switch, Cable Reach, Instant Barrier, Orbital Punch and Speed Shield
Over 30 all new feats including Boomerang Attack, Here's Mud In Your Eye!, Lingering Attack, Striking Costume and Where’s the Body?
Over 45 all new combo power stunts including Deadly Kiss, Fog Breath, Power Breaker and Wireless Datalink




If you are looking to add more super powers and variation to your OGL & D20 Superhero game and system, then this is the PDF for you. Best of all it is OGL and D20, so you can use it with the world most popular RPG rule set and should be easily compatible with any OGL and D20 Superhero genre based systems on the market today.

92455.name: Wondrous Elements
92455.description:
Publisher Blurb: Avalon Adventures, Vol 1, Issue #11

Fast and Fun, that’s the goal of Avalon Game’s Pathfinder line of Adventures. Each issue will bring you a small adventure, one that can be dropped into any campaign, used as a single one shot night of fun, or turned into a more complex and longer series of adventures. The goal is to give GM’s something that will bring an easy night of fun to their game, without having to cost and arm and a leg doing so.

Don’t wait, get all the adventure you will even need and come sit at the Round Table of Fun with Avalon Games.

92456.name: Henry V
92456.description:
From publisher blurb:

Henry the Fifth, or The Life of King Henry the Fifth as it is officially titled, is one of Shakespeare's histories of the English monarchy. Written and first performed in 1599, during a time of strife and unrest, Henry the Fifth is a classic work of patriotic propaganda. Queen Elizabeth I had ruled for forty years without ever taking a husband or getting an heir, and was well beyond child-bearing years; this led to a sense of uncertainty for the future. A rebellion in Ireland was gaining success against royal forces. Would this inspire the irascible Scots to launch a revolt of their own? And what of the Welsh, who had bent knees to the Norman kings longer than any? The ever-present twin threats of Spain and France loomed large in the minds of all Englishmen and women when set against such circumstances. England needed a hero. Shakespeare gave it one. This RPG sourcebook focus on the history and setting of this well known Shakespeare piece and how to integrate it into your regular local gaming session. This 12 page sourcebook also comes with several adventures seed with different endings to this classic play. You have read the dramatic piece, now play the adventure.

92457.name: Othello
92457.description:
From publisher blurb:

First performed at the court of King James I on November 1st, 1604, The Tragedy of Othello, the Moor of Venice is one of Shakespeare’s more unusual works. Set during the war between Venice and Turkey of almost a half-century prier, the play tells a sordid story of lust, hatred, revenge, murder, and suicide. Granted, these elements alone hardly mark the play as different from any of the Bard’s other tragedies. What makes Othello unique, however, is the title character; the play’s tragic hero. Men of color and Moors had often been portrayed in Elizabethan and Jacobean theatre, but usually as comic buffoons or as scheming villains. In Othello we find a noble and heroic man worthy of admiration; and by play’s end, the audience — no matter how white or how Christian — finds itself empathizing with the ruined warrior. This RPG sourcebook focus on the history and setting of this well known Shakespeare piece and how to integrate it into your regular local gaming session. This sourcebook also comes with several adventures seed with different endings to this classic play. You have read the dramatic piece, now play the adventure.

92458.name: Romeo & Juliet
92458.description:
From publisher blurb:

What can be said of the most prolific and archetypal love story in Western culture? That it is full of passion and tragedy, certainly. That it has moments of high comedy and skewering philosophical insights, most assuredly. But will it make a good role-playing game scenario? The author submits that it will. After all, it shares several traits with many a good adventure tale: there are the rival families, Capulet and Montague, waging an overt war on the streets and in the alleys of Verona; there is the love-struck hero, and the fair damsel imprisoned in their familial loyalties; there is intrigue, as the young lovers seek to hide their romance from the public eye, friend and foe alike; there is even the implication that supernatural forces are at work to shape the destinies of the “star-crossed lovers”. This RPG sourcebook focus on the history and setting of this well known Shakespeare piece and how to integrate it into your regular local gaming session. This sourcebook also comes with several adventures seed with different endings to this classic play. You have read the dramatic piece, now play the adventure.

92459.name: Magia i Miecz (Issue 40 - Apr 1997)
rpgissuearticle: Albion w świecie Warhammera. Część III - ostatnia.
Dawn, dawno temu, gdzieś w odległej galaktyce...
Magic: the Gathering. Acclaim vs. Microprose
Skrócone reguły dotyczące wykorzystania pojazdów w grze Warzone
92459.description:
user summary

Issue 40, articles will be submitted

92460.name: Ashes to Ashes
92460.description:
Publisher Blurb: Avalon Adventures, Vol 1, Issue #10

Fast and Fun, that’s the goal of Avalon Game’s Pathfinder line of Adventures. Each issue will bring you a small adventure, one that can be dropped into any campaign, used as a single one shot night of fun, or turned into a more complex and longer series of adventures. The goal is to give GM’s something that will bring an easy night of fun to their game, without having to cost and arm and a leg doing so.

Don’t wait, get all the adventure you will even need and come sit at the Round Table of Fun with Avalon Games.

92461.name: Magia i Miecz (Issue 41/42 - May/Jun 1997)
rpgissuearticle: Lista kart do gry Dark Eden
92461.description:
user summary

Issue 41/42, articles will be submitted

92462.name: Prince of Persia: The Fallen King
92462.description:
Prince of Persia: The Fallen King is a third-person action-adventure video game developed by Ubisoft Casablanca. The game is a spin-off of the game Prince of Persia (2008.)

The plot, taking place in ancient Persia, concerns the player character's role in a celestial battle between two gods; Ahriman and Ormazd. The player assumes the role of the Prince, and Zal, fighting Ahriman's forces with a variety of different physical and magical attacks.

Following the events of Prince of Persia and Prince of Persia Epilogue, the story begins with the split of the Prince and Elika. While Elika stays with the Ahura, leading the resistance against Ahriman, the Prince departs in search of the king of The City of New Dawn, in the hope that he can summon Ormazd, due to his affinity for the remnants of Ormazd's power. But here, the Prince finds a new ally, Zal, who introduces himself as one of the king's Magi and teams up with Prince to save the City of New Dawn from corruption and ultimately stop Ahriman.

The main objective of the game is to collect four pieces to a magical seal which will banish the evil god Ahriman from the region. The Nintendo DS stylus is used to maneuver the Prince by touching the touchscreen. The stylus is used to move the Prince, to do acrobatic moves, in combat, and to use Zal's magic. As the Prince and Zal progress in their adventure, Zal becomes Corrupted at certain points, in which the Prince has to pursue and defeat him. Sometimes, after being defeated, Zal gains new powers. These powers allow him and the Prince to perform gradually more advanced platforming maneuvers.

Platforming is done by using the Nintendo DS stylus, and tapping the touchscreen in the direction the player wants the Prince to move. For example, if the player wants to run up a wall, and jump back onto a rope, the player must first tap up the wall, then tap the rope. Sometimes, platforming implements combat as well. Combat is also done using the Nintendo DS stylus. There are three combat options; a sword strike, which causes the Prince to swing his sword to damage enemies; a block move, where the Prince defends himself against enemies; and a magic power triggered by Zal that does no damage, but causes the enemy to recoil, pushing them back should the duo be overwhelmed.

Source: Wikipedia, "Prince of Persia: The Fallen King," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

92464.name: Avatar: The Last Airbender (PC)
92464.description:
User Summary

Avatar: The Last Airbender is an action adventure title for Windows. The game differs from the console titles by the same name, and roughly follows the events of the first season of the television series Avatar: The Last Airbender.

Players control Aang as he travels from the Southern Water Tribe to the North Pole in an effort to find a Waterbending master. Prince Zuko of the Fire Nation, however, is on his tail, trying to capture him. Players play in a third person perspective and can switch between three offensive and three defensive moves during combat. There are a number of minigames built into the main storyline, such as flying on Appa and a meditation minigame.

92465.description:
Blocked aboard a spaceship fleeing the Earth, some of your companions contracted the strange disease which ravaged the humanity. The "Spore" takes the control of people who then become "mutants". Find these persons ! Look after them or kill them before being contaminated in turn. Unless it is too late and you are already one of them, leading the others to their loss.

Sporz is an easy game to set up. The players cooperate to find who is contaminated.
But be careful: Each player may secretly change camp and betray his original teammates. Novice and experienced players can play together. The victory of a team comes through successful communication, trust, and a good dose of bluff.

The game is highly inspired from Werewolf games, the essential differences are that players usually change team during play, rather than being killed, and that discussions are not public: People must interact one-on-one.

There is a game master, the Computer, who organizes the game.
At the beginning, each player gets one secret role.
Each round is alternatively Day and Night.
There are 2 teams: Healthy and Mutant.

Mutants act during the night and can do two actions each night (2 actions for the entire team):

Mutate a healthy character (unless he's resistant).
OR Kill another character.
AND Paralyze another character in order to skip his turn.




During the night, other roles can also act (such as the Psychologist or the Computer Scientist, who guesses the current number of mutants).

During the day, everybody can talk and secretly vote in order to execute 1 character. Yet, if blank votes have majority no one dies.
The game ends when all survivors belong to only one team.
92465.name: Sporz Original Outbreak

92466.name: Avatar: The Last Airbender (GBA)
92466.description:
User Summary

Avatar: The Last Airbender is an action adventure title for the Gameboy Advance. The game is different from the home console releases. Players control Aang, Sokka, and Katara as they travel across the four nations on a quest to end the war.

The game includes seven stages, each with an overworld and dungeon. The overworld lets players explore different towns and fight with Fire Nation soldiers using any of the playable characters, while the dungeons are chock full of puzzles that require the strategic use of each character’s unique abilities. Aang can push light objects with an air wave, Sokka can pull heavy levers, and Katara can create ice bridges with waterbending. As the game progresses, players will find upgrades that improve the heroes’ abilities.

92467.description:
This expansion adds 110 Ship cards to your Modern Naval Battles - Global Warfare game!

These cards do not require any new or special rules, just add them to your fleets and you are ready to play even bigger battles.

Included are more ships for the nine navies featured in the original game (USA, USSR, UK, France, China, Argentina, Taiwan, Norway, and Japan) plus 3 NEW navies! (Germany, Italy, and Canada)

We’ve also included several more civilian ships for escort scenarios.
92467.name: Modern Naval Battles:  Global Warfare Ship Expansion #1

92469.name: GoinDol
92469.description:
User Summary

A sometimes prehistoric ball and paddle game similar to Araknoid. Hit blocks, collect point and paddle upgrades, destroy everything to advance.

This game has a couple of angled bumpers similar to pinball, to bounce the ball around. There is also a slot machine like aspect. There are three spinning numbers. If you get them to match you can enter bonus levels.

There are 100 standard levels.

92470.name: Gravitar
videogameversion: Android (Atari Greatest Hits Arcade Emulation) edition
Android (Atari Greatest Hits Atari 2600 Emulation) edition
92470.description:
In the game, the player controls a small blue spacecraft. The game starts in a fictional solar system with several planets to explore. If the player moves his ship into a planet, he will be taken to a side-view landscape. Unlike many other shooting games, gravity plays a fair part in Gravitar: the ship will be pulled slowly to the deadly star in the overworld, and downward in the side-view levels.

The player has five buttons: two to rotate the ship left or right, one to shoot, one to activate the thruster, and one for both a tractor beam and force field.

In the side-view levels, the player has to destroy red bunkers that shoot constantly, and can also use the tractor beam to pick up blue fuel tanks. Once all of the bunkers are destroyed, the planet will blow up, and the player will earn a bonus. Once all planets are destroyed, the player will move onto another solar system.

The player will lose a life if he crashes into the terrain or gets hit by an enemy's shot, and the game will end immediately if fuel runs out.

On the 24th of March 2010, Gravitar was added onto the Xbox 360 and Games for Windows LIVE service, Game Room at a price point of 240 MS Points for a one-platform purchase, or 360 MS Points for a purchase on both platforms. For 40 MS Points, a user could play a one-off game. In July 2010, the Atari 2600 version of Gravitar was added to Game Room as well.

Source: Wikipedia, "Gravitar", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

92471.name: Great Guns
92471.description:
User Summary

An old school shooter. The cabinet is two mounted rifles. It has various fantasy, prehistoric and circus areas for shooting.

Features coop play, multiple levels and subpar graphics.

92472.name: Ground Effects
92472.description:
User Summary

A Formula-1 racing game. Race around a track against various AI opponents. Win races to proceed. Avoid crashing into cars and going off the track.

There is also a Super Ground Effects which is the same game in a sit-down cabinet.

92473.name: Growl
92473.description:
Growl, known in Japan as Runark (ルナーク), is a video game released by Taito in Japan in 1990, and even though the title screen of the U.S. version of Growl reads it was released in 1990, it was actually released in February 1991. In Europe, it was also released in 1991. Originating in the arcade, Growl is a typical beat 'em up game that is relatively unknown but has seen a port on the Sega Genesis and is part of the Taito Legends 2 collection.

"In the early part of the 20th century,a group of evil poachers recklessly hunted animals to the point of extinction."

At the beginning of the game the player selects one of four rangers: Gen, Burn, Khan, or Jack (these names came from the Genesis port and the four were unnamed in the arcade version). Like with most beat em up games each are balanced out with specific strengths and weaknesses in attack, jump, and life. Although a beat'em up, Growl was known more for its wide variety of weapons than its standard brawling.

The action starts immediately as the four heroes fight after their bar is attacked by evil poachers. The game is continuous through six stages of foes wielding various weapons that the player can freely pick up and use as well. Periodically through each of these stages the player will have to rescue animals from abuse and the animals in turn will aid the player for a certain amount of time, either by damaging enemies or killing them outright. One example of this is when you free an elephant at the end of stage four and it follows you into stage five, running over enemies and even decimating a tank ready to destroy you.

Source: Wikipedia, "Growl (video game)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

92474.name: Great Swordsman
92474.description:
User Summary

Fight with swords against AI opponents utilizing three styles of sword combat.

In this game, you can advance and retreat and attack with 3 styles of strike, low, mid and high.

Start with fencing against 3 opponents. You need 5 hits to win. Then bamboo swords in a samurai format (sports). 2 hits each will win. Then 3 gladiator opponents. One hit to victory. After each phase you can try to fend off arrows with your warrior in bonus rounds.

You are a Great Swordsman!!!

92475.name: Golfing Greats
92475.description:
User Summary

An old school 3d golfing game with lots of scrolling and panning. Different golfers have varying skill in driving, putting and special shots.

Make long drives, long puts and other goals to make your golfer better. 18 holes with bonus play.

92476.name: Golfing Greats 2
92476.description:
User Summary

An excellent upgrade from the predecessor, Golfing Greats. Game play is very similar but with much better graphics.

Experience 3d golfing game with lots of scrolling and panning. Different golfers have varying skill in driving, putting and special shots.

Make long drives, long puts and other goals to make your golfer better. 18 holes with bonus play.

92477.name: Golden Tee Golf
92477.description:
User Summary:

This is the first of the storied Golden Tee Golf game series. It starts with humble roots. This version is 2d. Only looking from behind the golfer. It still features 3 courses with varying tee shots. Games are played through 18 holes if you put in the quarters (1 for 3 holes of golf). Graphics were lackluster (very blocky).

The game follows the normal rules for golf play. All scoring is done for stroke play (hazards, water penalties etc.) You are provided with a standard set of clubs. 2-9 irons, 3 and 5 woods and a driver. Sand and pitch wedge and a putter.

Prior to the swing you can turn left or right. By rolling the roller ball (controller) back in a certain direction (for backswing) then foward in a certain direction, you can accomplish different shots including slices, hooks, fades and knock down shots.

92478.name: Golden Tee Golf II
92478.description:
User Summary:

Golden Tee 2 is the sequel to the popular Golden Tee. Game play is identical but has different courses. Graphics are very similar to its predecessor.

The game follows the normal rules for golf play. All scoring is done for stroke play (hazards, water penalties etc.) You are provided with a standard set of clubs. 2-9 irons, 3 and 5 woods and a driver. Sand and pitch wedge and a putter.

Prior to the swing you can turn left or right. By rolling the roller ball (controller) back in a certain direction (for backswing) then foward in a certain direction, you can accomplish different shots including slices, hooks, fades and knock down shots.

92479.name: Golden Tee 3d Golf
92479.description:
User Summary:

A huge step up for the Golden Tee franchise. This version offers significantly improved graphics. The game also made great advances in user control, primarily in the ability to moderate swing strength (as an aspect from the roller ball sensitivity.)

This version offers three courses (common throughout the series.) Also common for the next several versions offering one desert, one ocean (tropical) and one forrest course.

In this case it was Oak Valley, Ocean Pointe and Cactus Canyon.

The game follows the normal rules for golf play. All scoring is done for stroke play (hazards, water penalties etc.) You are provided with a standard set of clubs. 2-9 irons, 3 and 5 woods and a driver. Sand and pitch wedge and a putter.

Prior to the swing you can turn left or right. By rolling the roller ball (controller) back in a certain direction (for backswing) then foward in a certain direction, you can accomplish different shots including slices, hooks, fades and knock down shots.

The game also keeps track of high scores for each course including:
-the thirty best scores -Great golfer points (scored by getting shots within 5' of the hole from at least 50 yards out)
-longest drive
-longest putt
-fewest putts
-most greens hit
-most fairways hit
-most birdies
-most eagles or better

92480.name: Golden Tee '97
92480.description:
User Summary:

Golden tee 97 is the fourth game of the Golden Tee franchise

It offers three new courses: Pine Creek, Coral Ridge and Red Sands.

The game follows the normal rules for golf play. All scoring is done for stroke play (hazards, water penalties etc.) You are provided with a standard set of clubs. 2-9 irons, 3 and 5 woods and a driver. Sand and pitch wedge and a putter.

-longest drive
-longest putt
-fewest putts
-most greens hit
-most fairways hit
-most birdies
-most eagles or better

Aspen Lake (Par = 72)
Coconut Cove (Par = 72)
Rancho Saguaro (Par = 64)

92483.name: Golden Tee 2k
92483.description:

-most fairways hit
-most birdies
-most eagles or better

92484.name: Golden Tee Fore!
92484.description:
User Summary:

Golden Tee Fore! is the eighth version of the long running Golden Tee series. It offers three new courses to play. Mystic Hills, Suerte Del and Sol Crimson Rock

The game follows the normal rules for golf play. All scoring is done for stroke play (hazards, water penalties etc.) You are provided with a standard set of clubs. 2-9 irons, 3 and 5 woods and a driver. Sand and pitch wedge and a putter.

Prior to the swing you can turn left or right. By rolling the roller ball (controller) back in a certain direction (for backswing) then foward in a certain direction, you can accomplish different shots including slices, hooks, fades and knock down shots. There is also a backspin button to allow backspin on the green.

The game also keeps track of high scores for each course including:
-the thirty best scores -Great golfer points (scored by getting shots within 5' of the hole from at least 50 yards out)
-longest drive
-longest putt
-fewest putts
-most greens hit
-most fairways hit
-most birdies
-most eagles or better

Golden Tee Fore! has additional features such as player identification, statistics tracking and online tournaments. Player identification is enabled through the use of the Golden Tee Card. Players can use this card to keep track of stats and play in on-line tournaments.

92485.name: Golden Tee Supreme Edition Tournament
92485.description:
User Summary:

The game follows the normal rules for golf play. All scoring is done for stroke play (hazards, water penalties etc.) You are provided with a standard set of clubs. 2-9 irons, 3 and 5 woods and a driver. Sand and pitch wedge and a putter.

92486.name: Golden Tee Classic
92486.description:
User Summary:

The game follows the normal rules for golf play. All scoring is done for stroke play (hazards, water penalties etc.) You are provided with a standard set of clubs. 2-9 irons, 3 and 5 woods and a driver. Sand and pitch wedge and a putter.

92487.name: Golden Tee Fore! 2002
92487.description:
User Summary:

Golden Tee Fore! 2002 is the tenth version of the long running Golden Tee series. It offers five new courses to play.Pine Meadow, Bay Side, Rattlesnake, Maple Acres and Castle Shire

The game follows the normal rules for golf play. All scoring is done for stroke play (hazards, water penalties etc.) You are provided with a standard set of clubs. 2-9 irons, 3 and 5 woods and a driver. Sand and pitch wedge and a putter.

92488.name: Golden Tee Fore! 2003
92488.description:
User Summary:

Golden Tee Fore 2003 is the 12th version of the long running Golden Tee series. It offers five new courses to play. Buckhorn, Crawdad Kings, Cactus Canyon, Kiwi Springs and Bluestone

The game follows the normal rules for golf play. All scoring is done for stroke play (hazards, water penalties etc.) You are provided with a standard set of clubs. 2-9 irons, 3 and 5 woods and a driver. Sand and pitch wedge and a putter.

Prior to the swing you can turn left or right. -fewest putts

-most fairways hit
-most birdies
-most eagles or better

Golden Tee Fore! has additional features such as player identification, statistics tracking and online tournaments. Player identification is enabled through the use of the Golden Tee Card. Players can use this card to keep track of stats and play in on-line tournaments.

92490.name: Anzio The Bloodiest Beachhead
92490.description:
On 22nd January 1944, Allied forces landed at Anzio, a small coastal town just 30 miles south of Rome. This attack behind enemy lines, was intended to unhinge the German fortified Gustav Line.

The Germans responded quickly, containing the beachhead. The fighting was bitter, with both sides suffering high casualties. Intense artillery bombardments, water filled trenches and muddy conditions, made this battlefield a wretched place. The Allies would be on their beachhead for four long months before they were able to breakout and meet up with the rest of U.S. 5th Army.

The game represents the first six weeks of this campaign. It was a period when both sides attacked each other vigorously, looking for opportunities to break through the enemy defences, while desperately resisting enemy advances. By the beginning of March, both sides had fought each other to a standstill.

The Anzio rules bring differential based combat, single stacks attacking single stacks, Random Events, random strength Allied bombardments, historically based special abilities for some formations, anti tank values, bog checks for off road movement and disengagement tests when attempting to leave an enemy ZOC.

The presentation includes Large hexes and large counters to enhance the playing experience. The counters are provided on self adhesive paper and require the user to mount them onto card prior to cutting.

92491.name: Tortured Souls! (Issue 10 - Aug 1986)
92491.description:
From the back cover:

Issue 10 of Tortured Souls! contains the following scenarios:

Hijack: Lunatic AD&D/Basic scenario for a small party of 4th-5th level characters. Durindor's treaty with Shu-An is threatened when a group of terrorists take control of the ship carrying the envoy - the party are called in to deal with the maniac martial artists!

Who's Afraid?: An epic adventure in the Akrist Moutains for AD&D, Expert or Basic. Playable with a single 4th-5th level fighter, a pair of 3rd level characters or a small party of 1st-2nd level. The Mighty Zog, the Gummy Monster and the Orc named Goballot are the least of the perils, but there's no need to worry, after all - "Who's afraid of the Big Bad Wolf?"

Marasmus Redivivus: A module for 3th-4th level characters from the Zhalindor Campaign (a challenging series of independently playable pull-out modules for experienced AD&D players), set in the province of Tumaria. A previous opponent of the party has returned in undead form and now seeks a horrific revenge. Can the party defeat the legions of the damned?

Quezmak's Maze: A unique single-character module for AD&D or Expert Magic-User. A challenging test for any player - their character must enter the extra-dimensional lair of a powerful demon and assemble the fragments of a staff of power before the demon can find him. Who knows what traps are waiting for the hapless player in Quezmak's maze......

92492.name: Tortured Souls! (Issue 12 - Dec 1986)
rpgissuearticle: In the Shadow of the King
92492.description:
From the contents page:

Hammer & Tongs: AD&D/D&D module

The Barrow: AD&D/D&D/RQ module

Shadow of the King: AD&D/Zhalindor Campaign module

Necropolis II: AD&D/Expert module

The back cover of this issue consists of the FREE Colour Floorplans mentioned on the front cover ad

This is the last issue of Tortured Souls! magazine.

92493.name: Die Fugger II
videogamedeveloper: Sunflowers Interactive Entertainment Software GmbH (Sunflowers GmbH)
videogamepublisher: Sunflowers Interactive Entertainment Software GmbH (Sunflowers GmbH)
92493.description:
User Summary

Die Fugger 2 (The Fuggers being the de facto successors to the Medici) is a trading simulation set in a fictional medieval realm in central Europe.

Players will have to produce, transport and trade various goods, while trying to advance in the ranks of political office or the church, buy or hire mercenaries to guard or plunder transports and start a family.

Because of a lawsuit the following titles in this series have been named "The Guild".

92494.name: Flip For It
92494.description: Place eight number cards around the dice rolling bubble (Flippy). Press down on Flippy, let go, and watch him flip and roll the dice for you! Claim a card that matches the number on either die or their total. Easy-to-learn, fast-paced fun for the whole family!

92496.description:
From the back of the book:

For nearly 300 years, war has raged across the Inner Sphere as the rival Successor States fought one another and fearsome invaders called the Clans. This maelstrom of conflict has created untold suffering and destruction -- and a never-ending demand for the services of mercenary soldiers.

BattleTech Field Manual: Mercenaries provides an in-depth look at mercenaries in the 31st century, from the inner workings of a mercenary unit to detailed profiles of more than forty prominent mercenary bands. This how-to manual for would-be soldiers of fortune includes the histories, officers and favorite tactics of select mercenary units. special rules that reflect the unique capabilities of each mercenary command, and rules for creating and running your own BattleTech mercenary units.

User comment:

This was the last update in the Mercenary's Handbook series by FASA; the sequel to the earlier Mercenary's Handbook 3055, it provides an update on a broad swathe of Mercenary units in the Inner Sphere, updates the rules on running a Mercenary band, earning contracts, logistics and the like, as well as adding some new equipment rules.

Several years later, FanPro updated this Field Manual to reflect current events in the canon timeline, and issued a new version as Field Manual: Mercenaries (Revised) under a new product number.
92496.name: Battletech Field Manual: Mercenaries
boardgameexpansion: Classic Battletech Field Manual: Mercenaries Revised

92497.name: Pass the Pigs: Pig Party Edition
92497.description:
Pass the Pigs, in which players roll pig-shaped dice to score points, included one pair of pig dice. Deluxe Pass the Pigs doubled the swine count, with two pairs of pigs for head-to-head competition. Now Pass the Pigs: Pig Party Edition has brought home the bacon, doubling the pig count yet again with four pairs of pigs (pink, black, brown, tan) included in the box.

Game play is reminiscent of Pass The Pigs, but with more pigs and more scoring opportunities. Players try to win cards that display a specific goal (pigs in a particular orientation) and a point value. The game includes bonus cards, including a chance to roll all eight pigs at once. Sooooooo-eeeee!

Pass the Pigs: Pig Party Edition comes with a black, zip-up case to hold the game components.

boardgamehonor: 2011 As d'Or - Jeu de l'Année Nominee
92499.name: Djam
92499.description:
Classic themes or offset, a handful of dice and letters. Shake well, discover the theme and the letters of words to find and respond as quickly as possible!

At the beginning of the game, choose a card with 6 themes. At each turn, a player rolls a die defining the topic and then a color dice and dice marked with letters. The color dice determines the first letter of the word to find (in agreement with the assigned topic). The players play together and are entitled to one proposal per round. They earn as many chips as found in letters from the word found. Depending on the number of players, the last or the last 2 participants were not allowed to speak. If the color dice falls on the black face, one player can make a proposal. He must find a word does not include any letters learned. He won 4 chips if the word is correct and if it loses 4 proposal includes a letter from.

The game ends when there are no more chips in reserve. The player who has the most wins.

Much of this taken from the French here :
http://fr.asmodee.com/ressources/jeux_versions/djam.php



Des thèmes classiques ou décalés, une poignée de dés et des lettres. Agitez bien, découvrez le thème et les lettres des mots à trouver et répondez aussi vite que possible !Au début de la partie, on choisit une carte comprenant 6 thèmes. À chaque tour, un joueur lance un dé définissant le thème, puis un dé de couleurs et des dés marqués de lettres. Le dé de couleurs détermine la première lettre du mot à trouver (en accord avec le thème imposé). Les joueurs jouent en même temps et ont droit à une seule proposition par tour. Ils gagnent autant de jetons que de lettres tirées présentes dans le mot trouvé. Selon le nombre de joueurs, le dernier ou les 2 derniers participants n’ont pas le droit de parler. Si le dé de couleur tombe sur la face noire, un seul joueur peut faire une proposition. Il doit trouver un mot ne comprenant aucune des lettres tirées. Il remporte 4 jetons si son mot est correct et en perd 4 si sa proposition comporte une des lettres tirées.

La partie se termine quand il n’y a plus de jetons en réserve. Le joueur qui en possède le plus l’emporte.

92500.description:
From the back of the cover:

Since the distant time when mankind knew only one sky and one sun, soldiers of the proud units that became the Northwind Highlanders have won brilliant victories against often-desperate odds. From small-scale uprisings in ancient Scotland to epic struggles between mighty star empires over countless worlds, the Northwind Highlanders of every generation have added to their forebears' battlefield glory. Fiercely proud warriors, the Highlanders have left their legendary mark on the universe -- and will do so as long as war rages in the Inner Sphere.

The Northwind Highlanders is a BattleTech scenario pack that follows the career of this phenomenal unit, from its inception on Earth in the 18th century to the latest battles of the 31st century. Fourteen scenarios drawn from different periods in the Highlanders' distinguished history let players recreate the unit's greatest battles -- beginning with the First Kearny Highlanders' near-fatal first engagement in 2366, all the way up to the year 3059. Also included are a detailed unit history and a complete military roster. Players can use optional rules that reflect the specialties of each Highlander regiment in conjunction with the BattleTech: Field Manuals series to create their own Northwind Highlander scenarios.

User comment:

Part sourcebook, part scenario pack, this expansion gives more detail on the Northwind Highlanders than any previous sourcebook, alhough the fluff section makes up a smaller part of the book than the scenarios drawn from the Highlander's history including a small campaign against the Clans, details on the various Highlander regiments and a couple of items of new equipment. While the new equipment has been reprinted in the BattleTech Technical Readout: 3060 this particular expansion is out of print, and not currently available from the present licence holder.
92500.name: BattleTech: Northwind Highlanders

92001.description:
Think Quick, Act Faster!

Will you be the first to say "Arrrr!" like a pirate when a circle appears? Or clap your hands at the sight of dots? Don't cheer "Hooray!" for a square though...that was last round.

Players take turns flipping over cards which show different shapes. Be the first to complete the correct action and you win that card! But watch out - each round shuffles the actions, and their matching shapes. You score a point for each card awarded, and at the end of the game the player with the most points wins!

Contains 24 action cards, 8 shape cards and 40 flip cards.
92001.name: Befuzzled

92002.name: Psiduel
92002.description:
Psiduel is an intense, psychological dueling game for two players. Players take the role of psionic test subjects, pitted against one another in an "experiment" only one of them can survive. It is visceral and fast; playable in under 15 minutes.

At the beginning of a game, each player prepares a grid consisting of six cards face down. This grid represents the player’s psionic defenses. The card backs display a number from one to three, letting the opponent know the strength of the defense, but not the type.

Each player has an offense and defense deck to draw from. During a round, players burn cards off the top of a deck in order to play cards from their hand, either to replenish their defenses or attack.

The object of the game is to destroy your opponent’s defenses, and reduce them to zero life by attacking unoccupied spaces on their grid.

72 cards (2 decks of 36, one for each player) and a simple rule sheet come in the box. No add-ons required.

92003.name: Boing! Docomodake DS
92003.description:
From Back of Box to US edition

"Putting the 'fun' into fungi...

The annual festival is soon to take place in Docomodake Forest, but the Docomodake family is no where to be seen! Play as Papa Docomodake and use his special skills to find his family and get them to the festival on time!"

92004.name: NCAA Football 2005 / Top Spin
92004.description:
User Summary

This is a compilation for XBox that includes two games on the same disc: NCAA Football 2005 and Top Spin.

92005.description:
Non-Stop Safari is a 2 to 4 player print and play board game submission to the 2011 Global Game Jam. Players take on the role of rich financiers who send hunters on safari to find valuable animal pelts. Only the rarest pelts will fetch the highest price, and you can’t get more rare than extinct! By hunting a species to extinction players can guarantee a high return on their precious pelts. Oh, and watch out for poachers, unless of course, they’re working for you!

The object of the game is to be the player with the most money by the end of the game. The game ends immediately after the third species has gone extinct. All pelts of this species are sold off as usual and then money totals are counted.
92005.name: Non-Stop Safari

92006.name: Banjo-Kazooie: Grunty's Revenge
92006.description:
From the back of the box to the US Game Boy Advance edition

"Gruntilda is back and only Banjo and Kazooie can stop her master plan!

Travel through time encountering puzzles, battles, and meeting friends old and new in this all-new Banjo-Kazooie adventure!

Explore different worlds packed with over 60 contests!

Transform Banjo into an octopus, a tank, and more!

Battle dozens of different goons and enemies!"

92007.name: Sovereign: An open source board game project
92007.description:
The main objective of the game is to collect seven of one type of victory card. Players must balance their play between researching technologies, expanding cities and building units. Having only a limited number of actions per turn, it is important for players to consider their activities carefully so that they maximize their ability to collect cards. The first player to collect seven of one type of victory card wins the game.

This game is based on hex-grid map boards and players can choose which sections of the map to assemble. Currently there are maps of Europe and the Caribbean, although plans for future maps will cover the entire world. Players lay tiles down to form cities and can build military units to protect them or attack others. Cities create the wealth that a player needs to further their empire.

Players take turns to perform their moves, building their empire up while keeping a close eye on their neighbors to prevent them beating them to the end. Open play allows players to watch other players activities, and manage resources in way that can stop other players winning while not hindering their own advancement.

The game has been designed to give flexibility to the rules so that players can develop in-house versions of the rules without breaking the game. One popular alteration is in the collection of cards. Players can change the speed and dynamic of the game by changing how many and of which types of card need to be collected.

The game is fully customizable allowing players to design their own versions including army units, maps, technologies and rules. The online published version of the game can be downloaded and printed off for free.

Released under the Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike licence.

92008.name: Karate Champ
92008.description:
The player assumes the role of a Karate competitor and fights against another player or the computer. Using two joysticks, players can execute a number of moves.

Gameplay consists of a two dimensional fight between Karate characters wearing white and red gi, followed by various bonus rounds for the successful player. This pattern repeats itself in the next, more challenging round set against a new background. Unlike most later fighter-type games, there are no health bar or hit points. A hit successfully landed ends the round and earns the player or his opponent either one point or half point (along with a numeric score for the top ten but this has no effect on winning a match per se). The first to score two points is the winner. The game also featured some early speech synthesis, in which the judge would call out such phrases as "Fight!" or "Winner!" It's also spoken in Japanese in the Japanese version.

Source: Wikipedia, "Karate Champ", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

92009.name: Racket Attack
92009.description:
Overhead professional tennis.
It's the national tennis tournament, and the player has made it to the finals. He or she is known as one of the toughest players on the tour with his or her power serve and ferocious backhand. The player is considered a pro! But so is the opponent. He or she has played him or her in the past, and they both won a match.[3] The player is ready to show him/her and the millions watching that the player can take him/her. But he or she have to use every weapon at your disposal.

The player will have to work hard to beat his or her opponent's passing shots.Smash, volley, slice his or her way to the winning point. This is the match the player has been waiting for all year. Make the most of it. After all those long, hot practice sessions, the player ready to lift that trophy above his or her head.

Source: Wikipedia, "Racket Attack", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

92010.name: Rad Racer II
92010.description:
The gameplay of Rad Racer II is virtually identical to that of its predecessor: the idea of the game is to race around a course, and make it to check points before the car's fuel (game timer) runs out. If the player hits another vehicle, road sign or tree at a high speed, the car crashes. Crashes take time and make it more difficult for the player to reach the check point. To help prepare for high-speed turns, the dashboard has a preview direction indicator, an arrow that indicates which direction the track will take in the next few moments, allowing the player to position the vehicle accordingly. Also, the new ability in this version of the "Turbo Boost" is performed by holding the down arrow when the race begins until the audio countdown stops. Of course, this requires some practice, but it is quite useful.

Source: Wikipedia, "Rad Racer II", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

92011.name: Terra Cresta
videogamecompilation: Video Game Anthology vol.1: Moon Cresta & Terra Cresta
92011.description:
Terra Cresta' is a vertically scrolling shoot 'em up. The player controls a ship, initially with limited firepower. Numbered pods appear containing further parts of the ship that will increase firepower. These additional parts combine with the player's ship to increase its firepower, and the final module transforms it into a fiery phoenix which is invulnerable for a certain period of time. Once the ship has multiple sections, the player may also split it, allowing it to fire in multiple directions.

Source: Wikipedia, "Terra Cresta", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

92012.name: Bio Grafo The Biography Game of Skill and Chance
92012.description:
75 well-known authors and one work each is known for is the basis of this Bingo-type 'educational' game. Each player gets one of 40 'GRAFO' cards, a 5 by 5 grid where each square has an author number, an author's name, and his or her image. The caller randomly pulls from the stock of 75 tokens, and reads aloud the column letter (G, R, A, F, or O) and title of a play, book, poem, or short story and optionally the author number. If the author of that work is on his or her card, a player marks that square with a translucent disk, hoping to be the first to get five in a row. Can be played in three difficulty levels:

1) Playing by the numbers. The caller reads the column letter, title, and author number. This makes the game no harder than Bingo with some trivia thrown in.

2) Playing by the book. The caller omits the author number, but players have access to a "Bio/graphics" booklet in which they can find the author of the named work.

3) Playing for mastery. Players no longer have access to the book and have to recall from memory the author of the named work.

A player calls "Grafo" when he or she covers five squares in a row on his or her card, and once verified is declared the winner.

92013.description:
Milky Way Express is a Free Print-and-Play space trading and exploration game.

Game Summary
You start the game with a credit of $10 and your aim is to earn enough money throughout the game to pay back this loan when the game ends.
You will take turns moving your Spaceship on cards laid out as a chart of the Milky Way Galaxy, discovering new Planets as you go. You will throw dice to determine what goods will be on offer at each planet. Available goods will vary from turn to turn, so buy low and sell high while the market is friendly to you. But if luck abandons you, you may be driven to Bankruptcy by greedy Pirates and zealous Customs controls (if you dare to smuggle any illegal goods).
The game ends when you turn over the last unexplored card on the Galactic Chart, or when you run out of money.

This game is released under a Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial-ShareAlike 3.0 Unported License - that means you can use and modify the game for free, but you can't sell it or claim it as your own.
92013.name: Milky Way Express

92014.name: Lerara
92014.description:
From the frontpage of the module:

The fabled Passage of Sölerorin leads deep beneath the Hellfurnance Mountains, rumored to hold mysteries and treasure. Your group has prepared for a curious and perhaps lengthy expeditiondeep under the Flanaess. The town of Dark Gare is your last stop in civilization before leaving on your sunless journey. As you approach Dark Garehowever, you see an ominous column of smoke reaching into the sky. And where there's smoke. An adventure for APLs 2 to 16.

92015.description:
A game like soccer by Dieter Stein.

Gameplay

The game is played a certain amount of time (2 × 20 minutes are recommended). After the first half players change sides. The player scoring the most goals wins the game.

On each turn, firstly, a player throws the die. The number thrown represents moving and attacking points, which can be distributed freely among the football players (and/or the goalie) of the own team. Points can be used as moves or attacks.

Soccer teams are purchased separately, so that players can choose their favorites. Available teams are:

- Spain
- Brazil
- Germany
- France/Italy
- Portugal
- Netherlands
- Argentina
- England/Switzerland
- Australia/South Africa
- USA/Uruguay

92016.name: When Orcs Attack
92016.description:
From the frontpage of the module:

Welcome to the city of Eastfair, capital of the North Kingdom. Within its great granite walls, the people are save from all that might harm them from amongst the countryside. But what of the threats from within? There are children in trouble and the forces of good are greatly to the minority. You are needed to go into the countryside and rescue an orphanage. . Sounds simple, right? It would have been. But, with one too many drinks and a fistfight with a human officer, one of the local orc regiments has gone on yet another drunken rampage. Now the population gets another first hand view of . . . when orcs attack. An adventure for APL 2 - 6. Part One of the "Running with the Baatzu" series.

92017.name: The Book of 200 Feats
92017.description:
From the publisher's blurb:

FEATS, FEATS, FEATS
OK, in hindsight, perhaps we went a bit far. When I posted the suggestion a couple of months back for a big article filled with feats, the team jumped on this one. Really jumped. I had expected we could maybe come up with 100 or so and make a nice, tidy, little article for it.
Wrong.
As you can see from our cover story, we’ve gone far over expectation.In fact, we seem to have done that for the entire issue, ranking in at 85 pages, this is the largest one we’ve put together.

Enforcers by Todd Crapper - This isn’t about the law. It ’s about retribution.

The Book of 200 Feats by Todd Crapper, Shawn O'Leary & Tim Rose - It’s what the title says. Lots and lots of feats.

Gatekeepers: Disciplines of the Cursed by Todd Crapper - The corrupting touch of the Far Realm has its benefits.

The Righteous Flames of Roleph’Ral by James Kitchen - Absolute power corrupts absolutely.

REVIEW: Night Reign - Just how dark is the world of Falamar? by Michael "Neuroglyph" Evans

MESH HONG’s Bonus Bestiary by MESH HONG - The premiere of CA’s new monster feature, including a living essence of torment.

ADVENTURE: The Golden Hand by Corwin Riddle - An earthquake reveals a buried secret.

92019.name: The Elder Scrolls Adventures: Redguard
92019.description:
The Elder Scrolls Adventures: Redguard is an action-adventure game developed and published by Bethesda Softworks with a third person style, set in the world of The Elder Scrolls. The game takes place in Tamriel in the year 864 of the Second Era, some 400 years prior to the events of Arena and the rest of the series. The story is about Cyrus, a young Redguard, who arrives on the island of Stros M'kai in order to find his missing sister, Iszara, and subsequently finds himself in the middle of political intrigue.

Source: Wikipedia, "The Elder Scrolls Adventures: Redguard", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

92020.name: The Legend of Heroes II: Prophecy of the Moonlight Witch
videogameseries: The Legend of Heroes: Gagharv Trilogy
92020.description:
A long time ago, a girl traveled around Tirasweel. Her silver hair shone even in the moonlight, and her eyes were clear as a fountain.

She could cast a glance into the future. When good things happened, people admired her. When bad things happened, people accused her. Some people called her the Moonlight Witch.

A long time ago, a Witch traveled around Tirasweel. She disappeared, leaving many questions behind...

Source: Wikipedia, "The Legend of Heroes III: Prophecy of the Moonlight Witch", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

92021.name: Fighter Squadron: The Screamin' Demons Over Europe
92021.description:
The simulation player can man all the positions on WWII bombers such as the Boeing B-17 Flying Fortress, Avro Lancaster and Junkers Ju-88. Few combat flight simulators of this time had this feature. In addition, other aircraft could be flown in the simulation including the Lockheed P-38 Lightning, North American P-51 Mustang, Supermarine Spitfire, DeHavilland Mosquito, Hawker Typhoon, Focke-Wulf FW-190 and the Messerschmitt Me-262. The simulation featured a mission editor that players could use to create their own missions. Fan websites created numerous modifications of flight theaters or eras (World War I for example), new aircraft and new missions.

Source: Wikipedia, "Fighter Squadron: The Screamin' Demons Over Europe", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

92023.name: Valley Forge II: A Supplement to Valley Forge
92023.description:
Information compiled from the website tomeoftreasures.com with information from the designer.

This game is essentially an "errata section" for TSR's game Valley Forge, a game released at GenCon for the 1976 Bi-Centennial. However, this game product was self-published by the designer Dave Wesely as he was being called into the US Army. He hired former TSR employee David R. Megarry to work out the details. Combined with Valley Forge, this provides 44 pages of tactical rules.

Some copies were sold bundled with TSR's Valley Forge.

92024.name: Jakten på guldmynten
92024.description:
Jakten på guldmynten (The hunt for the goldcoins) is a dice game with characters from Disney, like Scrooge McDuck. You want to be the first player to achieve 10.000 points.

You roll 10 dices, and attempt to get dice with "pairs", like Donald, Daisy and Gladstone Gander (they have the same colour, red), you get a bonus, and also you can now roll the "coin-dice" trying to get a coin worth 1000 points. But without getting three dices with the faces of Beagle Boys. Dice with a star is a joker.

The game is similar to Monopoly Express.

92025.name: Through Nature to Eternity
92025.description:
From the frontpage of the module:

Recent discoveries in the Grand Duchy of Geoff point to a plot whose endpoint is so hideous the entire world of Oerth would be at stake. The Old Faith of Gyruff desperately require your intervention. An adventure for APLs 10 to 16.

92026.name: Anglin Action
92026.description:
When you get the urge to fish but can't launch the boat.... Here's the solution.

Anglin' Action is a game that involves matching fish with their correct location and lures. This allows a player to 'catch' the fish. All of the fish are assigned different values.
The winner is the player with the most 'fish points' at the end of the game.

Playing the Game:

Deal five action cards to each player.
Pile the remaining Action Cards, Lure Cards and Location Cards at the side of the table.

There are three simple phases that make up a player's turn:

Draw Phase: Draw one card from the game deck
Action Phase: You may play an Action Card if you want. Simply follow th einstructions on the Action Card. Limit one per turn.
Fish Phase: On this phase a player may do ONE of three things:

Move to a location- Take a location card and place in front of you.
Put on a lure- Take a lure card from your tackle box and place in front of you.
Catch a fish- Take a fish from your hand that matches the correct lure and correct location you are in.

Afteryour fishing phase is over the next player goes.

Winning:

The game ends when any player has caught their limit of ten fish. At this point the winner is determined by the player with the most points. Therefore the player who caught ten fish may not necessarily be the winner of the game.

92027.name: Daring Raccoon
92027.description:
Intro: Coon is about to go back home planet to rescue his parents. He is the last hope.

-PLAY stages !!
-BUILD your own stages !!
-DOWNLOAD others stage !!


NEW TYPE of Twitter Integrated Game !!!!



-Make NEW twitter FRIENDS by posting your feedback and stage!
-Hear feedbacks from iPONPOKO-Twitter users worldwide.
-Not twitter user ?, No problem to enjoy this game fully, You can build and download stage WITHOUT Twitter Account.


Exciting 60 Stages, need Your FAST fingers , SHARP eyes and SMART brain.



.Easy to Play (from 4yrs to 90yrs)
.Jump, run, rise, eat and FLY with two thumbs
.50 thrilling stages to play.(Looks simple but exciting)
.Accurate Control Pad (supports 8 directions) and one BIG Jump button.
.Post a tweet after finish a stage.
.Build Your Stage with ease.
.Share stages you built with friends.
.Can play your own stages.
.Post your stages to Twitter.
."Smart Stage Compression" makes a stage into a Tweet with your message.
.Can build EASY stages for kids.
.Download stages from other users.
.Without twitter ID, You can download stages.
.Twitter OAuth support (secured connection)
.Fun stages from user will be listed in Hot Stages section.
.Can enjoy others stage. Endless FUN!!

Source: The Developer Website.

92028.name: Killzone 2
92028.description:
Killzone 2 is a cardgame made by a fan of the Playstation 3 game called Killzone 2. It's a two player game, for free on the web. One player takes control of ISA (human) army, the other player is Helghast. The goal is to destroy enemy. There are two 63-card decks. In the first round, every players draw 6 cards. If they have at least 2 basic cards (soldiers and shock troopers), the battle begin.In each round, player draws one card and heals character for 10 points. Every round you have 10 Action Points and you can use them to:

-attack
-place basic character in spawn point
-evolve character (example= soldier can evolve to any V1 character [medic, saboteur etc.] or in soldier v2)
-place vechiles
-equip weapons, tools
-use tools

You can have:

1 Active Character
5 Spawn Point Characters
Vechile, Weapon, Tool

If enemy haven't got any characters on spawn point or in active character place, you win!

92030.name: InQuest (Issue 1 - May 1995)
rpgissuearticle: Card Stock - Like Rats on Cocaine
Editor's Letter - So Who the Hell Are We?
InQuest Contest: Headed to Gen Con 1995
Killer Decks - To Beat the Moxes
Opening Draw: Artists Turn Magic into Comics
Theme Deck - Flower Power: The Vegetarian Deck
92030.description:
From the Front Cover:


Win a full set of Magic: The Gathering
Complete gaming card price guides for: Magic, Illuminati, Star Trek, Jyhad, and more!


InQuest: The Future of Gaming

Free Rage gaming card inside!
How to build killer decks!
The true-life history of vampires!
Win a trip to Gen Con, details inside





User Summary:

The first issue of InQuest, launched as a magazine devoted to collectible card games, did still include content relevant to gamers in a wider context (including an article on the Vampire: The Masquerade RPG).

92031.name: Novus Corebook (Open Beta PDF)
92031.description:
From the PDF:

"Here there be dragons!" exclaimed the old Dwarven warrior, tapping on the map with the hook that had long ago replaced his hand. Korag and his friends started getting excited because all of the legends said that where there were dragons, you were sure to find treasure...

Onwards to new and exciting adventures! Novus is a brand new role-playing game from Firehawk Games.

Firehawk Games did not set out to re-invent the fireball, it tried to make a fun and flexible game that can easily be adapted to many different styles of role-playing and many different settings. Firehawk Games wants to give you an old school experience with modern, up to date rules, and we believe that Novus fits the bill perfectly.

With Novus, everything you need to start gaming is in one small book.

6 Player Races -- All of the classics; Human, Elves, Dwarves, Halflings, Half-Elf and Half-Orc.
8 Backgrounds -- Everything from Barbarian to Upper Class Urban.
10 Character Classes -- We have the Archer, Fighter, Mage, Mystic & Wizard, just to name a few.
Dozens of Spells -- spread among 6 Schools of Magic and the Universal Spells that any character is able to learn.
40+ Monsters -- including Demons, Devils, Dragons and many more, all waiting to be unleashed on your players.
Snag & Boons -- This allows you, the player, to take controls of your character’s own destiny when it comes to fumbles, failures and exceptional successes.

92032.name: Rondra-Vademecum
92032.description:
User summary

Everything you ever wanted to know about Rondra and her clerics.

History, rites, worldview, background, game rules and role-playing tips ... they're all here in this tiny volume. This volume is recommended reading for those portraying a cleric of Rondra in the world of Aventurien.

92033.name: Vater der Fluten
92033.description:
User summary

Guidelines for roleplaying in the setting used by the Drakensang computer games, with plenty of additional background.

Also includes a goodly amount of material for campaigning in the Kosch and Great River regions of Aventurien.

92034.name: Die Dunklen Zeiten
rpgissuearticle: Ein Blick in die Dunklen Zeiten
92034.description:
User summary

Dunkle Zeiten (Dark Times) provides material for creating campaigns in the dark ages of Aventurien, several centuries before the era in which Das Schwarze Auge is usually set.

Includes five sourcebooks and enough maps that you have to calculate their encumbrance value if you want to carry them with you.

92035.name: Hesinde-Vademecum
92035.description:
User summary

A manual that provides all the information players need to add background and depth to their clerics of Hesinde. It includes prayers, canticles, rituals, holy books, and other background information on the cults of Hesinde.

92036.name: Drachendämmerung
92036.description:
(from the back of the book)

"Dragon dusk - on the edge of immortality" is the fourth and final part of the Dragon Chronicles, the campaign around the legacies Pyrdacors and the fate of the dragon in Aventurien today. Friends of the computer game Drakensang will again find familiar elements or persons.

The search for the meaning of the Dragon Chronicle has led the heroes in the past adventures to the edge of the known world. This book takes you far beyond that. After the secret dragon history was revealed, now it is time to use it. This time the heroes are one step ahead of their opponents, and if they manage to maintain this advantage and expand upon it, they can use their knowledge and finally go into the offense.
Now, secrets from ancient times need no more to be found and deciphered, but the future of a foreign globule and its inhabitants must be determined.
Before the heroes return to Aventurien, they have to experience the fate of Zze Thas as well as its people and find that both have been manipulated by the same opponents, that are facing the heroes. They meet the creator of ZZe Tha, a mighty dragons whose path they crossed already in the course of the campaign, and must use all their connections and shrewdness.
The final adventure of the campaign is modular and includes a number of scenarios and adventures that can be played in different combinations and order.

92037.name: Hell 4 Leather
92037.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Joe Prince's Hell 4 Leather is a role-playing game inspired by tales of revenge as diverse as Hamlet, Kill Bill, The Crow and Ghost Rider.

A collaboration of hellish intent from Joe Prince (Contenders) and Gregor Hutton (3:16 Carnage Amongst The Stars) it uses Tarot Cards to deliver a liberating style of scene-based free-style role-playing brought to a focus with decisive card mechanics.

The Major Arcana denote the Major Characters, the Scenes to play, and the various Boons that advantage both the Fool and those who had him killed.

You have been murdered. The Devil himself has given you one night to bring vengeance on those who had you slain. What will you do with the hours that you have left on Earth? Go Hell 4 Leather!

Presented in a 6-page full-colour booklet on 150 gsm card stock and supplied with a 13-page print-friendly PDF file Hell 4 Leather will deliver you tales of revenge on Devil's Night.
rpgpodcastepisode: Actual Play: Hell 4 Leather, Part I
Actual Play: Hell 4 Leather, Part II

92038.name: Mit wehenden Bannern
92038.description:
(from the back of the book)
For years, the battle rages between the warlords for supremacy in the Wildermark. Recently, some success has been achieved, that gave hope for a return to order to those suffering under the yoke of despotism. But the struggle is not yet decided, and when a new threat on the Darpat is disclosed, the cards are mixed in the new Game of Thrones. While the Empress fights far away for the cohesion of her empire, the heroes are the last bastion of order. It is upt to them whether the battered country will find peace or the Wildermark finally sinks into a mess of blood and steel.

"Mit wehenden Bannern" continues the events of "Von Eigenen Gnaden", but can be played withou this book. The volume contains detailed descriptions of local powerbrokers and localities, background information as well as scenarios to expereince first hand the decisive phase in the battle for the Mark.

rpgitemversion: Heinz Con 2014 Edition faux leather version
92039.name: Die Welt der Schwertmeister
92039.description:
translated from the back of the book

Deep inside the world of Ethra or only reachable through strictly guarded gates there lies the mystical hollow world of Tharun with its multi-colored sun in the center and its vast, global ocean. Gods and giants wrestle since the birth to this world and its ancient secrets, and for some of them it is their last resort.

In Tharun reign the Swordmasters. As Guarei they may oppress the people at the behest of a ruler or rob it as bandits called Brigantai - they have one thing in common: They are virtuosos of the art of fencing, and they know no mercy in the exercise of their art. While the Swordmasters own everything, the farmers and fishermen have nothing - they are born to obey the ruling caste and serve.

Night gods control the fate of Tharun, whose sacred laws guard people against the unspoiled wilderness of the islands, their beasts and monsters, and against the manifold dangers of the mighty sea. The priests of the Eight, the Azarai, tolerate no argument and no other faith, and their temples and shrines adorn the fairytale palaces and forts of the island lords and Archipelares. All the sciences and arts as well as magic lies in the hands of selected castes like the seafaring Numinai, the legally qualified Zinakai and the magic-wielding Sombrai.

Nine large island kingdoms with hundreds of small islands form the populated part of the world, and all of their lords pay a tribute to a legendary Overlord: the Tharun! On top of the highest giant mountain he receives the grace of the gods, chosen to rule over the nations of the world.

In this volume we present the world of Tharun in detail. Discover the history and mythology of the hollow world, experience the hierarchical social orders and learn the principles of religious cults of the eight known gods. We take you on a tour of the Nine Kingdoms and their various cultures and conflicts, will introduce special personalities, power groups and places and reveal mysteries and secrets. Above all, we open up a world that was lost for many years in the dark, and can now be discovered again and filled with life!

92040.name: Schattenlande
rpgissuearticle: Mit der Kaleschka durch die Schattenlande
Stolz und Stärke - Mendena wird neue Hauptstadt
92040.description:
(from the back of the book)
The Shadowlands: Sometimes whispered anxiously, sometimes angrily shouted, the name details the regions where the struggle against the heirs of the Demonmaster continues. But these heirs are divided, envied by their peers and their domination threatened by the warriors of light. The faithful of twelve gods stretch into the former Tobrien, into Warunk and Beilunk reaching the heart of darkness, and it seems only a matter of time, until the worshippers of the demons fall, the people are liberated and heroes acquire eternal glory by the defeat of the Heptarchs.
On Maraskan, the Shîkanydad is countinuing ist merciless fight against Borbarad's heirs, with the interesting culture of Maraskan being a strong weapon.
The horrors of the island Maraskan are varied and almost incomprehensible: ancient mysteries hidden deep in the jungle, protected by deadly flora and fauna, and stubbornly defended by the henchmen of the black rulers.
The Shadowlands presents the regions in the east Aventurien that are still under the control of Borbarad's heirs or fought for by many warlords: Transysilien, the Warunkei and the Dukedom of Maraskan and Tobimorien. In addition, you will also find material on those bastions that stand against the dark princes: the sunland of Beilunk, teh vanguard at Warunk held by the church of Rondra and the Shîkanydad of Maraskan.

92041.name: One o'Clock Wake-Up
92041.description:
From publisher blurb:

"One o'Clock Wake-Up" follows the exploits of a handful of ordinary fighting men in the Battle of the Bulge, December 1944, as they set out to rescue an American unit trapped by the onrush of the dreaded berkommandogruppe SS - the first army composed entirely of Talents.

Written by GODLIKE co-creator Greg Stolze and Arc Dream editor Shane Ivey, and illustrated by GODLIKE author Dennis Detwiller, "One o'Clock Wake-Up" was featured at GenCon 2002 and GenCon UK 2003. It is the perfect introduction to the thrills and dangers of GODLIKE. (Length: 9 pages, with 2 illustrations and 3 maps.)

92042.name: Grim Tales Web Enhancement - Firearms: A Primer
92042.description:
From Introduction:

“And it was a great pity, so it was
That villainous saltpeter should be digg’d
Out of the bowels of the harmless earth,
Which many a good tall fellow had destroyed
So cowardly; and, but for the vile guns,
He would himself have been a soldier.”
- Shakespeare, Henry IV, act I, scene ii.

This work is not intended to be THE definitive work on the history and development of firearms. Far too many weapons of importance, large and small, exist for such a claim to be said of a work of this insignificant size. Instead, the following includes enough information to provide the reader with a reasonable road map of the rise of black powder weaponry from its meager, nigh-mythological beginnings to reach its current prevalent and orthodox worldwide acceptance in modern militaries, citizenry, and entertainment media.

user comment
this Item is a web enhancement for Grim Tales

92043.name: The Eidolon
videogameversion: UK Amstrad CPC floppy disk edition
92043.description:
User Summary

More than a hundred years ago, Dr Josef V. Agon disappeared while working on the mystical powers of the human mind. His Victorian mansion was left undisturbed, until one day you discover the iron gate opened. You enter the mansion and discover Dr Agon's research notes and a strange machine named the Eidolon. After reading the notes, you find out the Eidolon is a travelling machine, capable of transporting its pilot to strange mystical dimensions. You feel a sudden desire to start the machine...

The Eidolon is an arcade exploration game. The player pilots the machine in caves, collecting jewels and energy balls and looking for the dragon guarding the entry to the next level. The Eidolon can shoot four different energy balls: red balls are the most destructive, green balls transform a monster into a different one, blue balls stop time (freezing the target for a few seconds) and yellow balls heal. Shooting costs energy, so the player must pick up gold balls to replenish the machine's reserves. Jewels are needed to breach the energy barrier preventing access to the dragon; there are three on each level, each guarded by a different creature.

The game uses fractal algorithms to create the real-time 3D display of the cave environment.

boardgamehonor: 2011 Origins Awards Best Board Game Winner
92044.description:
From the publisher:

"War has come to the Dungeons & Dragons world! In the north, the undead legions of the Dark Empire of Karkoth march against the fragile League of Nerath, determined to sweep away the human kingdoms forever. To the south, the infernal Iron Circle launches its own goblin hordes in a campaign of conquest against the elves and corsairs of Vailin. From the snowy expanse of the Winterbole Forest to the sun-warmed coasts of ancient Vailin, four great powers struggle for survival."

Conquest of Nerath is a fantasy conquest game. 2-4 players muster armies of foot soldiers, siege engines, monsters, warships, elementals, and dragons to attack their opponents. Players employ heroes such as knights and wizards to lead their troops and explore dungeons in the search of magical artifacts and treasures to increase their power in combat.

The game includes the following components:
* Rulebook
* Dice
* Game board
* 110 cards, size "standard American board game"
** 80 Event Cards (20 per faction)
** 30 Treasure cards
* 252 plastic playing pieces representing the champions and armies of Nerath, Karkoth, the Iron Circle, and Vailin
92044.name: Dungeons & Dragons: Conquest of Nerath Board Game
boardgameexpansion: Conquest of Nerath: Sword of Kas Promo
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 19 - D&D Board Games Pit Fight
Point 2 Point Episode 50: WBC 2011 and Conquest of Nerath
The Gaming Gang Episode 26: Conquest of Nerath, Keep Up the Fire, Space Empires 4X, and Sun of York

92045.name: Geronimo
92045.description:
One player rolls five dice (each side of the die bearing a different color). The result is called "Geronimo". All players will ante chips into the pot. Each player will then ante another chip and then attempt to match the Geronimo. If three of the five dice match, he may reroll the remaining two. If one of the two match, he may then take a third roll of the remaining die. If the dice match the Geronimo, the player wins the pot. During play, other combinations of dice may win the player lesser rewards from the pot.

The game is over when the pot is exhausted and the winner has the most chips.

92046.description:
The Land of Lo’en is vast. Its Kingdoms and Guilds are populated by Humans, Elves, Dwarves, Goblins, Kobolds, Trolls, and of course, the Dragons. The Dragon King is dead now and you, as one of his many overlooked offspring, have decided that it’s time for a change.

Can you raise the funds to bribe the dragon clans to join your coup and the food to keep them? Can your strength convince the citizens of Lo’en to support your claim to the throne? Can your followers influence the diverse Kingdoms’ many Guilds and Clan Houses, and use their powerful resources to aid your cause?

Your siblings have dynastic plans of their own and the dead King’s influence, though weakening, must still be reckoned with. There will be many obstacles to surmount in your quest to claim the Dragon Throne.

Princes of the Dragon Throne is an area control and resource management board game that uses deck building as a driver for the other game elements. Players select cards from a continually changing pool of opportunities to build a unique deck of recruits. Players manage resources to support their uprising, and use the influence of their recruits to gain control of the various Guilds of the Kingdoms, which in turn gives them special abilities to further their cause.

Clever Mojo Games has contracted with Don Aguillo, an amazing talent with card game art experience, to create 120 new original artworks for Princes of the Dragon Throne and our card design format will highlight Don’s art in a bold and beautiful manner.
92046.name: Princes of the Dragon Throne
boardgamepodcastepisode: The Game Pit: Episode 23 - Reckoning the Spoils
The One About GenCon, DC and The WBC
The One About Origins, Chemistry and The Big Blue Noodle
The One About The Brothers MacKenzie

92047.name: Slavelords of Cydonia Web Enhancement
92047.description:
User summary:

A collection of maps for use with Slavelords of Cydonia.

92048.name: Through the Ebon Gate
92048.description:
From publisher blurb:
