You also get to take all units that have survived a battle, into the ensuing one. Furthermore, You can gain the upper hand in each battle by capturing and defending key towers. This enables you to summon more minions during each turn of the battle. Master of Monsters is a turn based game in which good strategy is the key to victory.

92147.name: Nowy Talizman (Issue 2)
rpgissuearticle: Nie ma tego złego co by na gorsze nie wyszło
92147.description: For a time alternative for Magia i Miecz.

92148.name: The War Master
92148.description:
From the introduction:

he war master is a new base class, designed for use with the Pathfinder RPG. It is a class designed to lead others in battle, using (mostly) nonmagical talents to grant combat benefits to friends and followers, place enemies at disadvantages, and use the many arts of war in all aspects of his life. A war master is designed to allow both experienced tacticians and players with no sense of strategy to play a cunning commander able to turn the tide of battle with a quick command, clever stratagem, and strong sword-arm used in just the right way at just the right time.

The war master is a warrior, leader, and strategist. As their name might suggest, typical war masters are first and foremost military commanders, able to both slay foes directly and to aid his allies by suggesting various tactics and maneuvers to maximize their gifts and minimize their weaknesses. But the art of war is far more than the ability to kill and lead killers, and war masters must also learn at least some skills of negotiation, espionage, and organization to dominate all aspects of armed conflict. Similarly, the lessons learned in battle can often be applied in less violent venues, allowing war masters to see how to gain advantage in a wide range of situations.

92149.name: Vampire: Master of Darkness
92149.description:
User summary:

Become the new Master! The current Master of Darkness leads a horde of bloodthirsty minions which you get to fight in sinister places such as cemeteries, gloomy castles and even a house of wax dolls. Use an array of primary and secondary weapons, defeat countless enemies and a powerful boss at the end of each stage before you can proceed to the next. Will you make it to your ultimate adversary, the Dracula himself?

92150.name: WWE: Legends of WrestleMania
92150.description:
From the Back of the Case
"Relive, rewrite and redefine the greatest moments in WrestleMania history. Over 40 superstars and managers.

Includes basic 1-on-1 matches, Steel Cage matches, Ladder matches, Tag Team, Royal Rumble, & Hell in a Cell."

92151.name: Wargame
92151.description:
Wargame is a strategy game for 2 players. Playing time is roughly 20 minutes.

Each player has 13 cards ranked from 13 (Bazooka) down to 1 (Spy). Cards of a higher rank typically take cards of a lower rank, though there are some exceptions (Spies, for example, take both the Bazooka and the Mortar, while Shooters can sometimes be "turned").

A player first deploys his cards by placing them, 1 and 2 at a time, into the 13 spaces on his line. Once all cards have been deployed, players take turns advancing their cards into the combat zone.

What makes the game interesting is the ability for players to switch two cards before advancing one into battle. Each player can do this exactly 5 times.

The goal is to win 7 of the 13 battles in the combat zone, or win 4 adjacent battles. The winner will almost always be the player who most skillfully utilizes his troops, as there is very little luck involved.

92152.description:
Race around the track, balancing speed and control, in this quick, free, print and play game for 2-3 players.

Each chariot consists of two dice, representing the speed and health of the chariot. Every turn players must decide between speeding up, slowing down, or attacking. The faster you go, the greater you risk uncontrolled movement. Players must navigate the track to avoid running up against the walls, crashing into other players or running over debris from previous races. The goal is to be the first to make it to the finish line, but in some races this will simply mean being able to survive to the end.
92152.name: Chariot Dice

92153.name: Hermes' Portal (Issue 1 - Sep 2001)
92153.description:
Hermes' Portal
Issue 1
An Independent Ars Magica Publication

92154.name: Fantasy Chronicles (Issue 1 - Jul 1986)
92154.description:
Cover by Jim Fitzpatrick

"First Issue"

"Free Colour Poster" (a cropped version of which is used for the cover art)

The table of contents is detailed in the Article list below.

92155.name: The Journeyman Project 3: Legacy of Time
videogamehonor: 1998 D.I.C.E. Adventure Game of the Year Nominee (Computer)
92155.description:
The Journeyman Project 3: Legacy of Time is a computer game developed by Presto Studios and is a sequel to The Journeyman Project and The Journeyman Project 2: Buried in Time.

Despite Agent 5's success in the previous games, time travel technology is deemed unsafe and the TSA is forced to close down. However, Agent 3, the culprit from Buried in Time causes a temporal rip and Gage Blackwood must travel back in time to find her, and discovers that aliens had destroyed an ancient Earth civilization. After finding Agent 3, he learns that a mysterious alien fleet has appeared in Symbiotry space and is heading towards Earth, looking for an ancient alien relic known as the Legacy of Time. Joining once again with his AI buddy Arthur, he must track down the pieces of the Legacy in the mythical cities of Atlantis, Shangri La, and El Dorado.

Source: Wikipedia, "The Journeyman Project 3: Legacy of Time", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

92156.name: Demon Codex: Spectrals
92156.description:
Publisher Blurb:

We Stayed Behind for a Purpose

Spectrals are fueled by their passions and their desperate connection to the world of the living. They ignored the calling of the Bright Lights for reason or another, only to continue on as ephemeral beings. Some find only despair in their choice, while other hope their final destiny still awaits. Could the dead truly hold the key to life itself?


...But Even Death Has Its Dangers

Demon Codex: Spectrals is the second racial sourcebook for Apocalypse Prevention, Inc. and serves as a complete guide to adding ghosts and spirits to your game as characters or antagonists. Details on their dead gatherings and horrible threats await within, along with several new Evolved Spirit types that go beyond what science has deemed possible.


Demon Codex: Spectrals Includes:

- Information on the daily existence of Spectrals and their involvement with API

- New Equipment, Magic, and Threats to the Dead

- New Evolved Spirit Types and playable races, like the shambling Walkers

92157.name: GalaXism
92157.description:
Your flagship has wandered into uncharted space and you've suddenly detected an unknown vessel with its weapons readied and shields raised! Will you be able to survive the encounter?

GalaXism (guh-lax-iz-um) is a starship combat game for 2-6 players that should take about an hour to play. Players control the flagships of ten different races, playing their cards as increases to shields, weapons, defenses, and various other ship statistics.

Cards are laid out around a flagship, each section corresponding to a different side of the ship from forward, aft, starboard, and port. In addition, there's the command deck where the ship is controlled. The upgrade cards have 4 icons each and are shifted up, left, right, and up-right to reveal more icons during the game.

This game is heavily influenced by Innovation but taken in a different way.

I have separated the rules from the components to make it easier on me to update the rules. This also makes the download smaller when there are changes to the rules so that you don't have to worry about printing out new components.

Current Rules: http://www.lyonesse.info/games/download.php?filename=GalaXis...

Current Components: http://www.lyonesse.info/games/download.php?filename=GalaXis...

Discussion Thread: http://boardgamegeek.com/thread/614464/wip-galaxism-a-quick-...

92158.name: Guardian Force
92158.description:
User Summary

A cooperative cooperative scrolling Tank Shooter. Get various weapon upgrades to better shoot futuristic mechanized enemies.

Features standard scrolling shooter game play with big bosses shooting massive amounts of bullets. Also features very colorful graphics.

92159.name: Gunforce: Battle Fire Engulfed Terror Island
92159.description:
User Summary

A scrolling shooter where you play a military fighter (man) who picks up various grenades, bazookas and other weapons to blow apart tanks, helicopters and troops. Fight bosses at the end of levels.

Play style is very similar to the Metal Slug line, but less cartoon-like graphics.
